ps140: О Lord, You enlightened Your apostles with the beams of the Comforter,* with the noetic radiance of the knowledge of You* setting them as beacons to the confirmation of the Faith, О Master;* wherefore, we bow down before Your ineffable love for mankind.

By the supplications of Your apostles, О Lord, You have protected this Your flock,* preserving it unharmed by the temptations of the enemy;* for with Your precious blood You redeemed it from enslavement to the enemy,* in that You are compassionate and the Lover of mankind.

Together you were shown to be like precious stones* set in the foundation of the Church,* with radiant brilliance shining forth upon the whole world the knowledge of God, О divine apostles,* who stand before the Trinity and pray for our souls.
aposticha: Fervently loving You on earth, О Lord,* Your apostles considered all to be but dung,* that they might acquire You alone;* and they gave their bodies over to wounds for You;* wherefore, glorified, they pray for our souls.

О Lord, You magnified the memory of the apostles on earth,* for assembling them together, we all glorify You;* since by their prayers and for their sake,* You grant healings, peace and great mercy to the whole world.

What virtue, what praise is due the saints?* For they bowed their heads beneath the sword for the sake of You* who bowed down the heavens and descended;* they shed their blood for You who emptied Yourself and assumed the form of a servant;* they humbled themselves even to death, emulating Your poverty.* By their prayers, О God, have mercy upon us* in the multitude of Your compassions.
I flee to your protection, O holy Virgin Theotokos,* for I know that through thee I shall obtain salvation;* for you are able to help me, O pure one.
